title: Emergence of Ra
description: Ra emerges from the primordial waters of Nun using his will to create himself and the universe.

title: Unification of Egypt
description: The unification of Upper and Lower Egypt by the first Pharaoh, Narmer (or Menes), marking the beginning of the Dynastic period.

title: Great Pyramid of Giza
description: Completion of the Great Pyramid for Pharaoh Khufu, a testament to the divine status of the Pharaohs.

title: The Titanomachy
description: The ten-year war between the Titans and the Olympians, ending with Zeus's victory and the imprisonment of the Titans in Tartarus.

title: Resurrection of Osiris
description: Isis resurrects her husband Osiris after his murder by Set, establishing him as the Lord of the Dead.

title: The Trojan War
description: The legendary conflict between the Greeks and the people of Troy, sparked by the abduction of Helen.

title: Iliad & Odyssey Copied
description: The approximate date when the oral traditions of Homer's epic poems were likely set down in writing.

title: Founding of Rome
description: Romulus kills his brother Remus and founds the city of Rome on the Palatine Hill.

title: Roman Republic Founded
description: The overthrow of the Roman Kingdom and the establishment of the Republic.

title: Kurukshetra War
description: The climactic war of the Mahabharata, marking the beginning of the Kali Yuga.

title: Yggdrasil & Nine Realms
description: The 'time before time' when the World Tree connects the Nine Realms, established by Odin and his brothers.

title: Start of Viking Age
description: The raid on Lindisfarne monastery marks the beginning of the Viking expansion and the wider spread of Norse mythology.

title: Death of Baldur
description: The tragic death of the god of light, orchestrated by Loki, which signals the coming of Ragnarok.

title: Prose Edda Written
description: Snorri Sturluson compiles the Prose Edda in Iceland, preserving the bulk of Norse mythology.

title: Transfer of the Land
description: Okuninushi yields control of the land (Japan) to Ninigi-no-Mikoto, grandson of Amaterasu.

title: Kojiki Compiled
description: The completion of the 'Records of Ancient Matters', the oldest surviving chronicle in Japan.
